executive_summary.overview: A California resident fell victim to a sophisticated pig butchering scam involving the fraudulent cryptocurrency trading platform Hikkod.com. The victim was initially contacted via a dating app, then moved to WhatsApp where a relationship was developed. The scammer convinced the victim to invest $15,000 in crypto trading, fabricated account growth to $570,000+, allowed a small $1,000 withdrawal to build trust, then blocked further withdrawals with a $20,000 'tax payment' demand. The website subsequently shut down.
key_findings: Textbook pig butchering scam with all classic elements present
Fraudulent trading platform Hikkod.com used for fund collection
Victim financial loss: $15,000+ with attempted secondary extraction of $20,000
Small withdrawal ($1,000) permitted to establish platform legitimacy
Fabricated account growth from $15,000 to $570,000+ to encourage continued investment
Website now defunct, eliminating victim access and evidence

impact_assessment.emotional_impact: High - romantic relationship betrayal combined with financial loss

execution: T1204.002 - User Execution: Malicious File (account creation)
persistence: T1543 - Create or Modify System Process (ongoing communication)
defense_evasion: T1027 - Obfuscated Files or Information (fake platform)
collection: T1005 - Data from Local System (personal information)

phase_1_initial_contact.description: Victim contacted on dating app, conversation initiated
success_indicators: Victim responds and engages in conversation

phase_2_platform_migration.description: Conversation moved from dating app to WhatsApp
techniques: Request to continue chat on WhatsApp

phase_3_trust_building.description: Extended relationship development to establish trust
techniques: Sharing of personal stories and experiences
success_indicators: Victim expresses trust, affection, or emotional attachment

phase_4_investment_introduction.description: Casual introduction of cryptocurrency trading opportunity
techniques: Positioning as helping victim earn money
Claims of hired analyst providing expert tips

phase_5_platform_onboarding.description: Guided account setup on fraudulent platform

phase_6_trust_reinforcement.description: Fabricated gains and small withdrawal to prove legitimacy
techniques: Display false account balance increases ($15k to $17k)
Provide trading tips claiming to be from analyst

financial_activity.psychological_effect: Platform legitimacy established, withdrawal fears eliminated

phase_7_continued_investment.description: Victim continues trading with fabricated massive returns
techniques: Encouragement to invest more or continue trading
Creation of greed and fear of missing out (FOMO)

phase_8_extraction_attempt.description: Large withdrawal blocked with advance fee fraud demand
techniques: Victim attempts to withdraw substantial funds
Claim fee required before withdrawal permitted
No actual withdrawal upon fee payment

financial_activity.victim_response: Unable or unwilling to pay additional $20,000

success_indicators: Victim recognizes scam or unable to pay

techniques: Communication cessation or continuation with excuses

impact.scammer_status: Moved to new victims or new infrastructure

ttps.name: Dating App Initial Contact
ttps.description: Scammer creates profile on dating app and initiates contact with potential victim. Profile designed to be attractive and trustworthy to target demographic.
detection_methods: Pattern analysis of rapid external migration requests
mitigation: Warning systems for external communication requests

ttps.name: Platform Migration to WhatsApp
ttps.description: Scammer requests to move conversation from dating app to WhatsApp, claiming preference for privacy, convenience, or app issues. This removes oversight and enables unmonitored communication.
indicators: Early request to move to WhatsApp/Telegram
Reluctance to stay on original platform
detection_methods: Dating platform monitoring for migration patterns
User warnings when external contact requested
mitigation: Platform warnings about moving conversations off-site
User education about scammer migration tactics

ttps.name: Extended Relationship Development
ttps.description: Scammer invests weeks to months developing emotional relationship with victim through daily conversations, personal sharing, and expressions of affection. This establishes trust foundation for later financial exploitation.
indicators: Avoidance of video calls or meetings
detection_methods: Difficult to detect - occurs in private communications
mitigation: Advice to never mix romance and investment

ttps.name: Investment Opportunity Introduction
ttps.description: After trust is established, scammer casually mentions their success in cryptocurrency trading, often claiming to have insider knowledge or expert guidance. Positions it as wanting to help victim improve financially.
indicators: Offers to help victim make money
detection_methods: Victim awareness of mixing romance and finance red flags
mitigation: Education that legitimate romantic partners don't push investments

ttps.name: Fraudulent Trading Platform
ttps.description: Scammers operate fake cryptocurrency trading platform (Hikkod.com) that mimics legitimate exchanges with charts, balances, and trading interfaces. Platform shows fabricated data to deceive victims.

ttps.name: Guided Account Setup
ttps.description: Scammer provides detailed instructions for creating account on fake platform, collecting credentials and personal information. Maintains control by guiding every step of the process.
detection_methods: Awareness that legitimate platforms don't require partner guidance
mitigation: Never create accounts at unknown platform's request

ttps.name: Authority Figure Introduction - Hired Analyst
ttps.technique: Claims of Professional Expert Providing Tips
ttps.description: Scammer claims to have hired a professional analyst who provides trading tips, adding credibility to trading guidance and explaining why victim should follow specific instructions.
indicators: Tips that result in shown profits
detection_methods: Recognition that real analysts don't work through romantic partners

ttps.name: Initial Cryptocurrency Transfer
ttps.description: Victim transfers $15,000 to platform/wallet address controlled by scammers. Cryptocurrency transaction is irreversible, ensuring scammers control funds immediately.
mitigation: Verify wallet addresses through independent sources
Check blockchain explorer for wallet history
Use only regulated exchanges with customer protection

ttps.name: Fabricated Account Balance Growth
ttps.description: Platform shows fake account balance increases from $15,000 to $17,000, then eventually to $570,000+. All figures are fabricated to encourage continued investment and create belief in platform legitimacy.
indicators: Balance increases that seem too good to be true
No ability to verify on public blockchain
detection_methods: Independent verification of balances on blockchain
mitigation: Verify all balances on public blockchain

ttps.name: Small Withdrawal Permission
ttps.technique: Allow Minor Withdrawal to Prove Legitimacy
ttps.description: Platform allows victim to withdraw $1,000 (a small portion of claimed balance). This proves funds are 'accessible,' eliminates victim withdrawal concerns, and encourages larger deposits. Scammers invest $1,000 to secure remaining $14,000+ and future deposits.
detection_methods: Recognition that one successful withdrawal doesn't guarantee future access
mitigation: Understand that scammers often allow small withdrawals
Don't increase investment based on single withdrawal
Attempt to withdraw all funds as test before adding more

ttps.name: Ongoing Trading Tips and Guidance
ttps.technique: Continued Direction via Claimed Expert Advice
ttps.description: Scammer provides regular trading tips allegedly from hired analyst, directing victim's actions on the platform and maintaining control over their trading behavior.
indicators: Guidance that results in shown profits
detection_methods: Awareness that legitimate investing doesn't involve partner direction

ttps.name: Personal Information Collection
ttps.description: Through relationship conversations and platform account setup, scammer collects extensive personal information including financial status, employment, personal history, and potentially reusable credentials.
mitigation: Be cautious about detailed personal disclosures

ttps.name: Advance Fee Fraud - Tax Payment Demand
ttps.description: When victim attempts to withdraw $570,000+ claimed balance, platform blocks withdrawal and demands $20,000 'tax payment' fee. Fee is completely fraudulent and payment would not result in withdrawal access.
detection_methods: Understanding that legitimate platforms deduct fees from balance
Knowledge that taxes aren't paid to trading platforms
Recognition of advance fee fraud tactics
mitigation: Never pay fees to withdraw your own money
Recognize withdrawal blocking as scam indicator
Cease communication and report to authorities

ttps.name: Website Shutdown and Exit
ttps.description: After victim unable/unwilling to pay fee, scammers take Hikkod.com offline, eliminating victim account access and destroying evidence. Scammers move to new infrastructure or victims.
indicators: Communication from scammer stops or continues with excuses

ttps.name: Cryptocurrency Wallet Fund Collection
ttps.technique: Centralized Wallet for Victim Fund Aggregation
ttps.description: Scammers use Ethereum wallet address 0xe89107246a3808602ad4946f485ec4bad51045b7 to collect victim funds. Wallet likely receives deposits from multiple victims and transfers to other wallets for layering and cash-out.
indicators: Multiple incoming transactions from different sources
Pattern of small outbound transactions (allowed withdrawals)
mitigation: Report wallet to exchanges for monitoring/blacklisting

domains.last_seen: Unknown - defunct at time of case report
domains.notes: Website no longer operational after scam completion

cryptocurrency_addresses.role: Primary wallet for victim deposit collection
cryptocurrency_addresses.associated_activity: Received victim's $15,000 initial deposit, likely received deposits from other victims
cryptocurrency_addresses.recommended_action: Blockchain forensic analysis, exchange reporting, transaction tracing, connected wallet identification

communication_platforms.role: Primary communication and command & control channel
communication_platforms.details: Used for relationship development, trading guidance, and scam coordination after migration from dating app
Used for initial victim identification and engagement before WhatsApp migration

behavioral_indicators.description: Request to move conversation from dating platform to WhatsApp early in interaction
behavioral_indicators.detection_value: Strong indicator of pig butchering scam initiation

behavioral_indicators.description: Introduction of cryptocurrency trading or investment opportunities within romantic relationship
Direction to use specific trading platform (Hikkod.com) rather than well-known exchanges
Account balance growth from $15,000 to $570,000+ (38x return)
behavioral_indicators.detection_value: Fabricated performance to encourage continued investment

behavioral_indicators.behavior: Small withdrawal followed by large withdrawal block
behavioral_indicators.description: $1,000 withdrawal allowed but larger withdrawal blocked with fee demand
behavioral_indicators.detection_value: Classic trust reinforcement followed by extraction attempt
Advance fee fraud component of pig butchering scam

behavioral_indicators.description: Website becomes inaccessible after scam completion

victim_profile.demographics: Adult, financially capable (had $15,000+ available for investment)
vulnerabilities_exploited: Unfamiliarity with pig butchering scam tactics
victim_profile.emotional_impact: High - combination of romantic betrayal and significant financial loss
victim_profile.recovery_likelihood: Very low - cryptocurrency transactions irreversible, website defunct, international operation

threat_actor_profile.likely_origin: Southeast Asia (Cambodia, Myanmar, Philippines, or Laos)
operation_characteristics: Multi-phase operation spanning weeks to months
Team operation (possible multiple operators, claimed analyst)
threat_actor_profile.potential_human_trafficking_connection: Moderate to High - many pig butchering operations use trafficked/forced labor for victim communication. Scammer may themselves be a victim working under threat.
threat_actor_profile.target_selection: Dating app users with financial capability, likely targeted based on profile indicators of wealth/employment

timeline.estimated_duration: Weeks to months (typical for pig butchering)

key_events.event: Scammer contacts victim on dating app
Victim continues trading, account shows $570,000+ balance
Victim attempts withdrawal, $20,000 tax fee demanded
key_events.significance: Secondary extraction attempt via advance fee fraud

key_events.event: Hikkod.com taken offline, victim loses access

immediate.objective: Trace fund flows, identify connected wallets, locate cash-out points

immediate.action: Report wallet address to major cryptocurrency exchanges
immediate.objective: Enable monitoring, potential freezing of funds if wallet interacts with exchange

immediate.action: File report with FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3)
immediate.objective: Official law enforcement documentation, contribution to broader investigation

immediate.responsible_party: Support organizations, law enforcement victim services
immediate.objective: Address emotional trauma, provide recovery resources

investigative.action: Historical DNS and WHOIS research for hikkod.com
investigative.objective: Identify registration details, hosting provider, operational timeline

investigative.action: Identify and analyze connected cryptocurrency wallets
investigative.objective: Map fund flow network, identify other victim deposits, locate cash-out methods

investigative.action: Collect and preserve WhatsApp communication evidence
investigative.objective: Document social engineering tactics, preserve scammer communications

investigative.action: Identify dating app used and report scammer profile
investigative.objective: Platform notification, potential profile removal, warning system activation

investigative.action: Search for similar cases with same infrastructure
investigative.objective: Identify other victims, establish operation scale, build comprehensive case
Document platform features, identify code patterns, potential attribution indicators

investigative.action: International law enforcement coordination (Southeast Asia focus)

preventive.action: Public awareness campaign about pig butchering tactics
preventive.objective: Educate public on scam recognition, prevention

preventive.action: Dating app partnership for enhanced scam detection
preventive.objective: Improve profile screening, detect migration requests, warn users

preventive.action: Cryptocurrency exchange monitoring and wallet blacklisting
preventive.objective: Prevent cash-out, freeze identified scam wallets, protect future victims

preventive.action: Educational materials on investment fraud red flags
preventive.objective: Help public recognize fraudulent investment schemes

preventive.action: Community alert distribution about hikkod.com and related domains
preventive.objective: Warn potential victims, document known scam infrastructure

intelligence_gaps: Specific dating app used for initial contact not identified
Scammer's actual identity, location, and affiliations unknown
Total funds collected by operation unknown
hikkod.com registration and hosting details need investigation
IP addresses for hikkod.com not documented
Whether victim actually sent funds to the identified wallet address needs confirmation
Blockchain details (which specific EVM chain) not confirmed
Whether scammer continued contact after website shutdown unknown
Any additional wallets or payment methods used not documented

correlation_opportunities: Pig butchering cases in California with dating app origins
Fake crypto trading platforms with similar UI/features
Southeast Asian pig butchering operation intelligence

pig_butchering_classification.justification: All classic pig butchering elements present: dating app contact, WhatsApp migration, relationship development, investment introduction, fake platform, fabricated returns, small withdrawal allowed, large withdrawal blocked with fee demand, website shutdown

cryptocurrency_involvement.justification: Ethereum wallet address provided, crypto trading platform theme, blockchain transaction characteristics mentioned

organized_crime_attribution.justification: Professional infrastructure, multi-phase operation, team indicators (analyst claim), proven playbook execution, typical of organized syndicates

southeast_asian_origin.justification: Consistent with known pig butchering operation centers, typical tactical patterns, but no definitive geographic proof in case narrative

wallet_address_validity.justification: Proper Ethereum address format, case explicitly states it was found, minimal risk of transcription error

lessons_learned: Pig butchering scams continue to successfully exploit victims through combination of romance and investment fraud
Small withdrawal allowance ($1,000) is highly effective trust-building tactic
Fabricated massive returns ($570,000+ from $15,000) create strong psychological motivation for victims to attempt withdrawal
Advance fee fraud ($20,000 tax demand) serves as both additional extraction attempt and operation conclusion trigger
Website shutdown eliminates victim access and evidence, complicating recovery and investigation
Cryptocurrency wallet addresses are critical investigative leads when website infrastructure is defunct
Multi-platform operation (dating app → WhatsApp → fake website) successfully evades individual platform safeguards
Extended relationship building (weeks to months) creates sufficient trust for substantial financial transfers
Claimed expert guidance ('hired analyst') adds credibility and provides justification for specific victim actions
Victims may not recognize scam until withdrawal is blocked, after substantial emotional and financial investment

metadata.framework_version: 6-Step Chain of Thought TTP Analysis Framework v1.0
limitations: Analysis based solely on victim narrative without independent verification
No blockchain analysis performed yet on identified wallet
No technical infrastructure investigation conducted for hikkod.com
Specific dating app platform not identified
Exact dates and detailed timeline not available
